headline.seo: Excerpt - Future Babble - By Dan Gardner

docs.lead_paragraph: “They’re wrong a lot, those experts. History is littered with their failed predictions. Whole books can be filled with them. Many have been.”
docs.snippet: “They’re wrong a lot, those experts. History is littered with their failed predictions. Whole books can be filled with them. Many have been.”

docs.abstract: The global obesity epidemic may have more causes than you think.
docs.lead_paragraph: There are many different explanations for the global obesity epidemic, but here's one I hadn't come across. Petra Jansen and others studied obese children for a forthcoming issue of Appetite and found that these children performed poorly on what is called chronometric mental rotation test, which measures spatial ability. Maybe some people are less astute at judging portion sizes or even their own body mass.
docs.snippet: The global obesity epidemic may have more causes than you think.

headline.print_headline: PATTERNS: For Heart Risk, No Telltale Body Shape
headline.main: Patterns: For Heart Risk, No Telltale Body Shape

docs.lead_paragraph: Among patients who had a heart attack or stroke, whether someone carried excess weight like an “apple” or a “pear” was not a predictor of risk, a study found.
docs.snippet: Among patients who had a heart attack or stroke, whether someone carried excess weight like an “apple” or a “pear” was not a predictor of risk, a study found.
